bibliography_entries.line_html: The Synaxaria tell a different story of the martyrdom of Simon, here identified as Nathanael of Cana. Two tales are given of his early life, followed by his evangelizing mission in the country of the Zindj and the Bedjas, as well as the Island of Bartanaii. He is opposed by the inhabitants but baptizes many. He is martyred when some gentile opponents hang him on a tree.
bibliography_entries.line_text: The Synaxaria tell a different story of the martyrdom of Simon, here identified as Nathanael of Cana. Two tales are given of his early life, followed by his evangelizing mission in the country of the Zindj and the Bedjas, as well as the Island of Bartanaii. He is opposed by the inhabitants but baptizes many. He is martyred when some gentile opponents hang him on a tree.
